boat.construction_details: Carvel - Pitch Pine on oak.  New sheathed deck '88, transom '89, re-rigged to original Albert Strange drawings '96/7.
boat.full_description: Galatea was built in 1930 as a cutter in by Anderson, Ridgen and Perkins of Whitstable, Kent, of pitch pine on oak frames. During a re-fit in the 1996/97 for her then owner Richard Blomfield, she was changed to the original yawl rig as drawn by Albert Strange in his design no. 112, from 1910. Ed Allen purchased her in 2004 and kept her at Wrabness on the River Stour. Ed writes about his new purchase on the Albert Strange Association website. She was a few years later purchased from Ed by Gordon Scott who still owns her.
boat.name: Galatea
boat.short_description: Galatea is a 1910 design by Albert Strange, the transom version of design noumber 112, "Cherub III"
